data.fullContent: The polio virus had nearly been eradicated, due to strong vaccination programs over the past half-century. However, it still exists in small pockets around the world, presenting a significant ongoing health risk. A recent outbreak has caused paralysis in nearly 20 children. Each case of paralysis may reflect that as many as 200 other people were exposed to the virus.
data.answer: 在过去的半个世纪里，由于强有力的疫苗接种计划，脊髓灰质炎病毒几乎被根除。然而，它仍然存在于世界各地的小地区，构成重大的持续健康风险。最近的一次疫情导致近20名儿童瘫痪。每一例瘫痪都可能反映出多达200人曾接触过这种病毒。
